info.title: E-Com Plus Store API
info.description:
[E-Com Plus](https://www.e-com.plus)
is a robust and flexible cloud commerce software,
totally based on REST APIs, providing a large library of methods and specifications
to deploy any digital commerce operation easly

**Store API** is the "hearth" of our software, a REST interface to the
[MongoDB](https://www.mongodb.com/) stores database,
given full access to all store data, so be creative, but be careful too

_With great power comes great responsibility_, _may the force be with you_!

## Overview

This API tries to be truly *RESTful*, following Web API Standards, taking as specifications references:

- https://github.com/WhiteHouse/api-standards

- https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html

### Host

Should be accessed from `https://api.e-com.plus/{version}/`

Current version: **v1**

https://api.e-com.plus/v1/

Note that every request must be with `https` (SSL)

All endpoints will end with `.json`:

https://api.e-com.plus/v1/example.json

### Sandbox

Sandbox environment is available at `https://sandbox.e-com.plus/{version}/`,
must be used for tests only, after homologation you should migrate to
[production](#introduction/overview/host)

Current version and formats will always be the same of
[production environment](#introduction/overview/host)

**All data in the sandbox environment is deleted after 7 days**

This documentation uses sandbox by reference on the examples

### Format

Both request and response body are formatted as JSON, always an object `{}`

#### Object Modeling

Based on [JSON Schema](http://json-schema.org/) Draft-06 specifications

API uses JSON Schema
[built-in string formats](https://spacetelescope.github.io/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#built-in-formats)
and [Regular Expressions](https://regexr.com/) (RegEx) to validate string fields on body

For example purposes, you can generate random objects with the schemas using
[JSON Schema Faker](http://json-schema-faker.js.org/)

#### List Of Documents

At root of a resource or an embedded documents subresource, response body will follow this pattern:

- Always an object with *meta* and *result* properties

- `meta` is an object

- `result` is an array of objects

```
{
  "meta": {
  },
  "result": [
    {}, {}
    ...
  ]
}
```

### URL Params

URL parameters (query string) are used only at endpoints that returns
[lists of documents](#introduction/overview/format),
setting metadata (`meta`) for filtering and pagination purposes, accepted params will vary by each endpoint

#### Common Parameters

- *limit*
    - Set the maximum number of documents to return
    - Must be an integer > 0
    - eg.: `?limit=1000`

- *offset*
    - Specifies the first entry to return
    - An integer >= 0
    - eg.: `?offset=1000`, `?offset=0`

- *sort*
    - Specifies rules to order the resultant objects
    - Default is ascending order, use - for descending
    - eg.: `?sort=-popularity`, `?sort=price,-popularity`

- *fields*
    - Specifies the object properties to return
    - eg.: `?fields=code`, `?fields=name,code,date`

Other parameters must be valid properties of the objects, will be used to filter results

It's possible to use
[MongoDB dot notation](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/core/document/#dot-notation)
to filter by embedded arrays and objects

### Headers

All requests must have the header `X-Store-ID` with the unique ID (integer) of respective store

Optionally *X-Cache-Tag* with any value to refuse or update browser cache, *Content-Type*
(*application/json, charset=utf-8*) and *Accept-Encoding*

### Verbs

| Verb    | CRUD           | Description             |
|:--------|----------------|-------------------------|
| GET     | Read           | View object             |
| POST    | Create         | Create new object       |
| PATCH   | Update/Modify  | Update some properties  |
| PUT     | Update/Replace | Overwrite entire object |
| DELETE  | Delete         | Remove object           |
| OPTIONS | -              | Return allowed methods  |

### Authentication

Authentication is not required always, the majority of the resources accept GET requests
without authentication, in some cases, authenticated requests return different body, more complete response

OPTIONS requests are always public

POST, PATCH, PUT and DELETE always require authentication

#### Authentication Headers

You must complete the [steps to authenticate](#reference/authenticate-yourself),
then use the received *access_token* and *my_id* on headers `X-Access-Token` and `X-My-ID` respectively

### Status Codes

Based on HTTP/1.1 Status Code Definitions:

- *2xx* - Successful

- *4xx* - Client error, must check the request

- *5xx* - Server error, report us and try again later

#### Response HTTP Status Code

| Code  | Description  |
|:------|--------------|
| `200` | OK, successful GET request |
| `201` | Created, successful POST request |
| `202` | Accepted, at root (/) only |
| `204` | No content, successful PATCH, PUT or DELETE request |
| `400` | Bad request, problem in request body or URL params |
| `401` | Unauthorized, need authentication and permission |
| `403` | Forbidden, plan limits reached or client blocked |
| `404` | Not found, resource or ID doesn't exists |
| `405` | Method not allowed, resource doesn't accept used verb |
| `406` | Not acceptable, problem with resource ID or subresource |
| `412` | Precondition failed, no store found with provided ID |
| `417` | Expectation failed, missing some header |
| `500` | Internal server error, please report and try again later |
| `502` | Bad gateway, try again later |
| `503` | Service unavailable, probably blocked by proxy, wait |
| `504` | Gateway timeout, try again later |

## Error Handling

#### App Errors

All *4xx* (client error) and *5xx* (server error) responses from application
will have body following the model below:

- *(object)*
    - `status` *(number)* - HTTP status code
    - `error_code` *(string, number)* - API error code
    - `message` *(string)* - Message to developer
    - `user_message` *(object)* - Messages to end user
        - `en_us` *(string)*
        - `pt_br` *(string)*
    - `more_info` *(string, null)* - External link

**Example**

```
{
  "status": 406,
  "error_code": 123,
  "message": "Invalid value on resource ID",
  "user_message": {
    "en_us": "The informed ID is invalid",
    "pt_br": "O ID informado é inválido"
  },
  "more_info": null
}
```

To know how to treat this errors, see
[status codes reference](#introduction/overview/status-codes)

#### Web Server Errors

In some cases you can receive an error directly from NGINX web server,
even in this case the response will be a JSON object, almost in the same model
of [App Errors](#introduction/error-handling/app-errors),
but without properties `user_message` and `more_info`,
the `error_code` will be an negative integer

##### NGINX 404

```
{
  "status": 404,
  "error_code": -44,
  "message": "Page not found"
}
```

Incorrect URL paths, check [API Host](#introduction/overview/host)

##### NGINX 503

```
{
  "status": 503,
  "error_code": -53,
  "message": "Service unavailable (DDoS?), wait few seconds"
}
```

NGINX is blocking your requests for security reasons, please wait few seconds and try again

## Server Limits

Whenever possible, **avoid using requests with query string**,
then you will be able to consume cache and send up to 30 _GET_ requests per second
with the same IP, to different endpoints

Not cached responses are limited by default to 6 requests per IP per second, but it can vary (to low)
depending of the resource

The same API user (authentication) can make up to 6 authenticated requests per second

In almost all cases you will not receive an error if you go beyond the limits,
the response will only be delayed, but even so,
we recommend that you create treatments in case you receive a *503* status code

## See Also

- [Developers site](https://developers.e-com.plus)

- [GitHub organization](https://github.com/ecomclub)

- [Community](https://community.e-com.plus)

#### Other REST APIs

- [Main](https://ecomplus.docs.apiary.io):
E-Com Plus Main API, with some public data about stores and channels

- [Graphs](https://ecomgraphs.docs.apiary.io):
Recommendations API using Neo4j to define related products by categories, brands and common orders

- [Search](https://ecomsearch.docs.apiary.io):
Powerful text search API using Elasticsearch to find and suggest items (products) and terms

## Getting Help

Feel free to get help or suggest alterations on
[GitHub repo](https://github.com/ecomclub/ecomplus-api-docs) or by e-mail
[ti@e-com.club](mailto:ti@e-com.club)

post.summary: View User ID And API Key

post.description:
If you don't know the store ID, you can login with username and password only,
passing any positive integer on `X-Store-ID` header

_id.description: User object ID, same returned from login

api_key.description: User API key, 128 bytes hexadecimal string, same returned from login

authorized_stores.description: IDs from other stores authorized to sell this product

subtitle.description: Optional subtitle intended to be used for SEO or layout purposes

slug.description: Slug to complete page URL, starting with number or lowercase letter

mobile_link.description: Optional URL specific to mobile devices

status.description: Status defined by seller, such as draft or live

available.description: True when product is complete registered and ready to sell

visible.description: Visible on search results, collections and catalogs

ad_relevance.description: Number to define the importance of the ad, the higher should be displayed first

ad_type.description: Option ad type defined by seller, such as gold and silver

short_description.description: Short product description in plain text

body_html.description: Full product description, may use HTML tags

body_text.description: Full product description, plain text only

meta_description.description: Meta description tag for page SEO

keywords.description: Tags related with product for internal search

price.description: Product sale price, when undefined, product could be bought by any price

start.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation

end.description: Promotion end date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation

price_effective_date.description: How long sale price is valid, out of this range (if defined), base_price should be applied

base_price.description: Product original sale price, without discounts

cost_price.description: Product cost price to calculate profit

currency_id.description: Designator of currency according to ISO 4217 (3 uppercase letters)

currency_symbol.description: Graphic symbol used as a shorthand for currency's name

quantity.description: Product quantity available to sell, max to put in cart

min_quantity.description: Minimum quantity to put in cart

days.description: Number of days to post the product after purchase, deadline for production or handling

working_days.description: If the deadline is calculated in working days

cumulative.description: If the production time is cumulative per product unit

max_time.description: When cumulative, increase the term proportionally up to this maximum (in days)

production_time.description: Deadline for production or handling of pre-ordered product

manage_stock.description: Decrease product available quantity automatically after each order

date_of_change.description: Date and time when stock changed in ISO 8601 standard representation

origin.description: Optional note about origin or reason of stock changing

precision.description: Maximum number of decimal places in the product quantity (in unit of measure)

pricing_base_measure.description: Quantity to calculate the price to be shown on ads, such as GMC unit_pricing_base_measure

measurement.description: Measure and dimension of your product when users might be interested in price per unit

multipack.description: Indicate that this item is a group of multiple identical products

dimensions.description: Product dimensions with packaging for freight calculation

size.description: Image size (width x height) in px, such as 100x50 (100px width, 50px height)

alt.description: Alternative text, HTML alt tag (important for SEO)

ml_category_id.description: Preferential category of the product in the Mercado Libre Taxonomy

google_product_category_id.description: Preferential category of the product in the Google Products Taxonomy

grids.description: Grids for specifications and variations, grid_id as property name, such as gender or colors

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the specification (custom value)

value.description: Value in the Google Product Specification

energy_efficiency_class.description: Attribute to tell users the energy efficiency class of your product

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the specification (custom value)

value.description: Value in the Google Product Specification

age_group.description: Attribute to set the demographic that your product is designed for

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the specification (custom value)

value.description: Value in the Google Product Specification

gender.description: Specify for what gender your product is designed

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

material.description: Attribute to describe the main fabric or material that your product is made of

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

pattern.description: Attribute to describe the pattern or graphic printed on your product

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

size.description: Attribute to describe the standardized size of your product

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Value in the Google Product Specification

size_type.description: Attribute to describe the cut of your product

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Value in the Google Product Specification

size_system.description: Which country's sizing system your product uses

text.description: Color name

colors.description: Product color palette, list ordered by importance, starting by main color

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the specification

value.description: Default normalized value to use in integrations

external_values.description: Normalized values to use in specific integrations (ID in property)

^[a-z0-9_]{2,30}$.description: Custom product attributes, grid_id as property name

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

size.description: Image size (width x height) in px, such as 100x50 (100px width, 50px height)

alt.description: Alternative text, HTML alt tag (important for SEO)

videos.description: List of videos related to your product

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

label.description: Title for this customization field, can be the grid title

grid_id.description: If this field is related to a grid, put the grid_id

require.description: If field is required (true), customer must always choose a value

text.description: Option text value displayed for the client

colors.description: Option color palette (if the field involves colors), starting by main color

add_to_price.description: Specific price alteration if customer choose this option

options.description: Pre-defined options for this customization field, option_id as property name

custom_value.description: If this field accept custom value defined by customer

attachment.description: If this field accept customer file attachment

add_to_price.description: Default (to all options) price alteration if customer use this field

name.description: Product name for this specific variation

gtin.description: Global Trade Item Numbers (barcode number): UPC, EAN, JAN, ISBN, ITF-14

mpn.description: Unique code specified by manufacturer to identify the product

price.description: Variation sale price, when undefined, product default price should be used

base_price.description: Variation original sale price, without discounts

cost_price.description: Variation cost price to calculate profit

number.description: Default number of installments for this product variation

quantity.description: Product quantity available to sell, max to put in cart

min_quantity.description: Minimum quantity to put in cart

days.description: Number of days to post after purchase, deadline for production or handling

working_days.description: If the deadline is calculated in working days

cumulative.description: If the production time is cumulative per unit

max_time.description: When cumulative, increase up to this maximum in days

production_time.description: Deadline for production or handling of pre-ordered product

dimensions.description: Product dimensions with packaging for freight calculation

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

material.description: Attribute to describe the main fabric or material that your product is made of

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

pattern.description: Attribute to describe the pattern or graphic printed on your product

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the attribute

value.description: Default normalized value to use on GMC and other integrations

size.description: Attribute to describe the standardized size of your product

text.description: Color name

colors.description: Variation color palette, list ordered by importance, starting by main color

text.description: Text displayed for the client describing the specification

value.description: Default normalized value to use in integrations

external_values.description: Normalized values to use in specific integrations (ID in property)

^[a-z0-9_]{2,30}$.description: Custom variation attributes, grid_id as property name

picture_id.description: ID of one of the product pictures for this variation

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

description.description: Some optional notes to describe for what this price is intended

currency_id.description: Designator of currency according to ISO 4217 (3 uppercase letters)

currency_symbol.description: Graphic symbol used as a shorthand for currency's name

date_of_change.description: Date and time when price changed in ISO 8601 standard representation

currency_id.description: Designator of currency according to ISO 4217 (3 uppercase letters)

currency_symbol.description: Graphic symbol used as a shorthand for currency's name

price_change_records.description: Historical of recent practiced sale prices

payment_method_id.description: Specify ID if this installments option is for an specific payment method

number.description: Default number of installments for this product

label.description: Name of payment method or other label describing applicable discount

payment_method_id.description: Specify ID if this discount is for an specific payment method

discount.description: Default discount option, commonly by payment method

progressive_discount.description: Progressive discounts options, product quantity as property name

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

description.description: Some optional notes to describe for what this discount is intended

items.description: This product and others composing buy together, product ID as property name

name.description: The name of the loyalty points program

program_id.description: Unique identifier, program name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore

points_value.description: Number of loyalty points a customer receives when purchasing the product

ratio.description: The ratio of a point when converted to currency

loyalty_points.description: Specify how many and what type of loyalty points a customer receives

label.description: Name of payment method shown to customers

installments.description: Installment options, installments number as property name

payment_methods.description: Payment methods for this product, application ID as property name

label.description: Name of shipping method shown to customers

shipping_methods.description: Shipping methods, application ID as property name

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

add_to_price.description: Additional value for this gift wrap

zip_codes_range.description: ZIP codes range for shipping rules (include or exclude)

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

items.description: Shipping origin, ZIP code and identifier

zip_codes.description: Collection of ZIP codes of product origin locations

rate.description: Tax rate as a percentage of the price

tax_ship.description: Whether you charge tax on shipping

zip_codes_range.description: ZIP codes range defining region to apply tax

tax.description: List of taxes applied by region

label.description: Label shown to customer, if you want to use a title other than the product name

variation_id.description: ID to specify a variation if has_variations is true, it's optional

kit_composition.description: If this product is a kit, set its composition

parent_item_id.description: Parent product ID, if this product is contained by another (a kit)

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

items.description: A list with products related to this

auto_fill_related_products.description: True when related products lists should be created and updated automatically (ML)

items.description: Global Trade Item Numbers (barcode number): UPC, EAN, JAN, ISBN, ITF-14
Unique code specified by manufacturer to identify the product

code.description: Unique reference code to identify this seller

doc_type.description: Responsible person or organization document type

doc_number.description: Responsible person or organization document number (only numbers)

inscription_type.description: Municipal or state registration if exists

inscription_number.description: Municipal or state registration number (with characters) if exists

corporate_name.description: Registered company name or responsible fullname

contact_email.description: Public email address for news and general contact

seller.description: Whether the product is sold by a third party, usual in marketplaces

namespace.description: String to help distinguish who (or which app) created and can use the metafield
String to help distinguish who (or which app) created and can use the metafield

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this product

grid_id.description: Unique identifier, grid name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore

option_id.description: Unique identifier, option name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore

text.description: Option text value displayed for the client

value.description: Default normalized value to use in integrations

external_values.description: Normalized values to use in specific integrations (ID in property)

colors.description: Option color palette (if the grid involves colors), starting by main color

add_to_price.description: Default price alteration for product with this option for customization or variations

options.description: Pre-defined options for this grid, used in specifications, customization and variations

custom_value.description: If this grid accept custom value defined by customer (product customization)

attachment.description: If this grid accept customer file attachment

add_to_price.description: Default price alteration for product with this grid for customization or variations

namespace.description: String to help distinguish who (or which app) created and can use the metafield

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this grid

state.description: The state of registration, if completed, invited and waiting, or declined by customer

enabled.description: Whether customer account is enabled to make orders

login.description: Whether the customer can sign in to the store with this account

status.description: Status defined by seller, such as active or blocked

referral.description: ID of customer who invited this new customer, if he was invited by another account

medium.description: Parameter "utm_medium", the marketing medium: (e.g. cpc, banner, email)

campaign.description: Parameter "utm_campaign", the product, promo code, or slogan (e.g. spring_sale)

utm.description: UTM campaign HTTP parameters associated with this customer's first access

provider.description: The provider with which the user authenticated, eg.: facebook

user_id.description: Unique ID for the user generated by the service provider

locale.description: Customer language two letters code, sometimes with region, eg.: pt_br, fr, en_us

verified.description: States whether or not the email address has been verified

accepts_marketing.description: Indicates whether customer would like to receive email updates from the shop

display_name.description: The name of this Customer, suitable for display

family_name.description: The family name of this user, or "last name"

middle_name.description: The middle name(s) of this user

gender.description: Customer gender, female, male or third gender (X)

country_code.description: Country calling code (without +), defined by standards E.123 and E.164

number.description: The actual phone number, digits only

doc_country.description: Country of document origin, an ISO 3166-2 code

doc_number.description: Responsible person or organization document number (only numbers)

corporate_name.description: Registered company name or responsible fullname

complement.description: Address complement or second line, such as apartment number

near_to.description: Some optional other reference for this address

private_metafields.description: List of custom attributes, hidden by default, visible for the order buyers

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this order

staff_notes.description: Description and notes about this order, available only for shop administrators

state.description: The working state of this app in the shop

slug.description: App unique slug, only lowercase letters, numbers and hyphen

version.description: Version of the application that was installed, eg.: 1.0.0

version_date.description: When app installation was updated, date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation

module.description: If this app is a package of a module, specify the module

load_events.description: If this app is a dashboard or storefront JS, specify resources that trigger the script load

status.description: Status defined by seller, such as active or waiting

authentication.description: Whether this app needs to authenticate with API

auth_callback_uri.description: Endpoint that receives POST back with authentication credentials, must be https

auth_scope.description: If this app uses authentication, list the needed permissions

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this user

application/json.title: Application private data, available only with authentication

datetime.description: When event occurred, date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation

authentication_id.description: ID of used authentication, should be a valid hexadecimal

subresource.description: Subresource slug (which appears in the URL), if specified

fields.description: Document fields involved (created or updated) with the event

inserted_id.description: Unique ID of created object, only for POST method

short_description.description: Short procedure description in plain text

method.description: Method (HTTP verb) of the event, if undefined will match any method

action.description: Type of action taken, if undefined will match any action

subresource.description: Subresource slug (which appears in the URL), if specified

field.description: Property created or updated with the event, if undefined will match any fields

triggers.description: List of events that call this procedure

field.description: Body property to compare (variable), use dot notation for nested objects

value.description: Numeric value to compare with field value

str_value.description: String value to compare with field, use if operator is "str_equal" or "str_not_equal"

conditionals.description: Conditions to continue with the procedure, based on trigger body

endpoint.description: API endpoint, such as /products.json, you can also include variables

store_api.description: Use this property if webhook is to store API (api.e-com.plus)

uri.description: Full URL to external API endpoint, you can also use variables here

value.description: Header field value, you can also use variables here

headers.description: List of headers to be sent on the request

external_api.description: Use this property if webhook is to any external API (not api.e-com.plus)

api.description: API where notification should be sent

send_body.description: Send body on notification, if true and map_body undefined, trigger body will be sent

map_body.description: Object to send, it is possible to use variables as properties values

webhooks.description: List of notifications to be sent when this procedure is called. In some properties you can use variables from trigger object with (tr.*) notation, eg.: (tr.body.name)

tag.description: Tag to identify object, use only lowercase letters, digits and underscore

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this procedure

result.title: My procedure
result.short_description: Do something after some other thing

example.title: Reduce inventory after new order
example.short_description: After receive order, reduce products available quantity to control stock

application/json.title: Reduce inventory after new order
application/json.short_description: After receive order, reduce products available quantity to control stock

segment_id.description: ID of store main segment, get options and IDs at /segments.json

doc_type.description: Responsible person or organization document type

doc_number.description: Responsible person or organization document number (only numbers)

inscription_type.description: Municipal or state registration if exists

inscription_number.description: Municipal or state registration number (with characters) if exists

corporate_name.description: Registered company name or responsible fullname

representant_name.description: Name of company representative for commercial contact

contact_email.description: Public email address for news and general contact

financial_email.description: Email address to receive notifications, invoices and vouchers

size.description: Image size (width x height) in px, such as 100x50 (100px width, 50px height)

alt.description: Alternative text, HTML alt tag (important for SEO)

items.description: Language two letters code, sometimes with region, eg.: pt_br, fr, en_us

languages.description: List of available languages on store channels

oauth_providers.description: Providers for OAuth customer authentication in store

application/json.name: Minha Loja Online
application/json.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

example.description: Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.

username.description: Simple username for identification, only numbers and lowercase letters

locale.description: User language two letter code, sometimes with region, eg.: pt_br, fr, en_us

pass_md5_hash.description: MD5 hash generated with the user's password

panel_preferences.description: User preferences in the admin dashboard

panel_shortcuts.description: Keyboard shortcuts, keys separated by + as property name

panel_random_cards.description: Number of random cards to show on dashboard home

card_id.description: Unique identifier, card name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore

paragraph.description: Card text, usually a brief description

panel_cards.description: List of dashboard cards chosen by user

items.description: Unique identifier, card name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore

panel_dismissed_cards.description: List of dashboard dismissed cards, by card_id

items.description: Resource property name with dot notation for nested object

panel_form_fields.description: Custom (user-selected) fields to display on dashboard forms, resource as property name

edit_storefront.description: Whether the user is able to use builder and file manager to edit storefront

notes.description: Optional notes with additional info about this user
